unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Indian Film Fest Scene
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Indian Film Fest Scene

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema connoisseurs! Ever wondered where all those offbeat, thought-provoking, and downright *amazing* films you don't see in your local multiplex come from? Well, the answer often lies in FILM FESTIVALS, baby!
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema connoisseurs! Ever wondered where all those offbeat, thought-provoking, and downright amazing films you don't see in your local multiplex come from? Well, the answer often lies in film festivals, baby!

unnormalised: Forget your popcorn-munching experience at PVR; these aren't your average movie nights. Film festivals are vibrant celebrations of cinema, showcasing indie gems, documentaries that'll blow your mind, and foreign films you never knew existed. Think of it as a giant, movie-themed mela!
normalised: Forget your popcorn-munching experience at P V R; these aren't your average movie nights. Film festivals are vibrant celebrations of cinema, showcasing indie gems, documentaries that'll blow your mind, and foreign films you never knew existed. Think of it as a giant, movie-themed mela!

unnormalised: India's got a booming festival scene. The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is the OG, the granddaddy of them all. Every November, Goa transforms into a cinephile's paradise, with screenings, masterclasses, and enough celebrity spotting to make your head spin. Remember when SRK inaugurated it back in 2017? Epic!
normalised: India's got a booming festival scene. The International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa is the O G, the granddaddy of them all. Every November, Goa transforms into a cinephile's paradise, with screenings, masterclasses, and enough celebrity spotting to make your head spin. Remember when S R K inaugurated it back in two thousand and seventeen? Epic!

unnormalised: But it's not just Goa. The Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI) is a must-attend for any serious film lover. Plus, there are smaller, niche festivals popping up all over the country, focusing on everything from short films to regional cinema. Imagine catching a screening of a Rajasthani folk film festival in Jaipur! Or a documentary fest in Kerala focusing on environmental issues!

unnormalised: Why should YOU go? Besides the chance to see incredible films, festivals are a fantastic way to network. Aspiring filmmakers, actors, and writers can rub shoulders with industry pros. Maybe you'll even bump into Anurag Kashyap grabbing a chai! You never know!
normalised: Why should you go? Besides the chance to see incredible films, festivals are a fantastic way to network. Aspiring filmmakers, actors, and writers can rub shoulders with industry pros. Maybe you'll even bump into Anurag Kashyap grabbing a chai! You never know!

unnormalised: Tickets usually range from Rs. 50 to Rs. 500 per screening, depending on the festival. And hey, think of it as an investment in your cultural capital. You’ll come back with stories to tell and recommendations that’ll make you the coolest person at your next chai break. Plus, the street food is usually amazing! Seriously, the vada pav outside IFFI is legendary. Trust me, it's worth the 10 km trek!
